question: Enumerate every distinct top-level window currently visible. For each, provide app/product name, host-vs-remote context, and whether it is fully visible or partially occluded. Return the list in front-to-back order where provable.
risked: Merged windows; incorrect z-order where no overlap exists
regression_detection: stable window list schema + explicit NO_EVIDENCE markers

question: Which window appears focused for keyboard input? Provide two independent visual evidence items and include exact highlighted/selected text for each evidence item.
In the most prominent reading/detail pane, extract subject/title, sender/display identity, organization/domain-only value, and the labels of primary action buttons.
Extract the full visible activity timeline from the active detail pane: timestamp plus associated activity text, preserving top-to-bottom order.
regression_detection: ordered row array with timestamp+text per row

question: Extract all visible key-value fields from the details form in on-screen order, including present-but-empty fields as empty strings.
regression_detection: ordered keys retained with explicit empty values

question: From the visible calendar/schedule panel, return month+year, selected date, and the first five visible schedule rows (time + title) in display order.
regression_detection: strict tuple count + parsed selection state

question: In the visible chat/DM thread, transcribe the last two visible messages as sender, timestamp, and exact text; also provide one sentence describing the embedded thumbnail without inferring hidden content.
Extract the changelog/summary section from the top-left engineering notes area, including all bullet lines, file paths, and exact test command shown.
For the console area with mixed text colors, classify each visible line as red/green/other and return counts per class plus the full text of all red lines.
regression_detection: count tuple + extracted red line list

question: For each visible browser window, return active tab title, address-bar hostname (hostname only), and visible tab count for that window.
regression_detection: per-window tuple schema with hostname validation

question: Compute a cross-panel elapsed-time metric using two independently visible timestamps. Return both source timestamps and elapsed minutes with a short rationale.
risked: Timezone mismatch or wrong timestamp binding
regression_detection: structured output includes both timestamps + delta

question: Find numeric presets visible in one panel and verify each against any visible clamp/range rule in another panel. Return sum, range, and validity per value.
risked: Wrong range linkage or arithmetic drift

question: Identify two numeric values referenced in one communication panel, infer their best matching parameter name from technical notes, and produce example request query strings using those values.
improved: Semantic grounding across chat and code notes

question: Convert the visible control-flow script logic into pseudocode with explicit branch conditions, retry behavior, and terminal success/failure outcomes.
risked: Missing branch guards or retry predicates
regression_detection: must include switch condition and retry condition

question: Detect one correctness issue in a visible script/log message where the referenced variable may not match actual runtime behavior. Provide the corrected line.
improved: Grounded static reasoning from on-screen code

question: Normalize one ambiguous form field into a canonical schema with separate presence and value fields, and provide deterministic transformed values for the visible record.
regression_detection: canonical key set + deterministic transformed output

question: Count completed checklist items in the engineering notes/log area and identify the currently running action line directly below the checklist.
In a message list region, count rows marked with an unread visual indicator for the currently selected date bucket only, excluding other buckets.
Classify visible carousel/content tiles into three semantic classes and return per-class counts plus the entity title used for each classification.
Return screenshot-normalized bounding boxes for two named actionable controls visible in the active detail card, with coordinates in [0,1] and deterministic ordering.
